originalText.text: This women saved my life and my sanity , I was so sick by the time I found her all because of the wrong doctors sound such harm to me physically having my gallbladder removed unesserarly,. Having other doctors tell me it's 8n my head because cinwas not better from their reccomendations . Within. A month of seeing Dr Lusak she gave me back my life and took me off of 8 different medicines .

originalText.text: There's a reason why this physician has such poor reviews. She's a nasty person that doesn't care about her patients. In fact, I'd say she is a bully. She talks over her patients and gives 'routine' prescriptions without thought.  And this was before my most recent interaction. When my case became difficult diagnostically, she dropped me like a hot potato saying that I was "too complicated and too ill" for her to manage. This is purportedly an experienced gastroenterologist at Cornell! Worse yet, she couldn't/wouldn't refer me to another physician, on-staff or off, which is tantamount to abandonment but rather, she told me call some random referral service. I would not recommend her to anyone, not even a dog. I suspect she doesn't have a good relationship with her institution, department, or colleagues since she is so disconnected.

originalText.text: Dr. Lucak is a terrific Physician. She is present, that is right there with me as her patient. She listens to me and my complaints or descriptions or questions...and she speaks clearly and wisely when she addresses my concerns. She is very knowledgeable and all her advise to me about my diagnosis and treatment have been helpful and accurate. I strongly recommend anyone looking for an outstanding professional health care provider to see her.

originalText.text:
If you have gastrointestinal issues, see another doctor! If you want a routine colonoscopy at the clinic that she has a financial interest in, then see her.  I went to her after seeing three doctors about stomach pain, she said that I needed a colonoscopy and to take Miralax, but not diagnosing the issue. After the colonoscopy, she told me take Miralax for the rest of my life.

She only processes an insurance billing code for a routine colonoscopy, not for a diagnostic colonoscopy, which the secondary insurance will not cover it. After the first appointment, she diagnosed for general anxiety disorder on every visit, as well!

I wished I had looked at all her negative reviews and bullying comments prior to making an appointment.

originalText.text: Dr Lucak is very proffessional, experienced and knowledgeable physician. I would recommend her to anyone with stomach issues. She explains well and she is a doctor who actually takes the time to listen. I am in the best hands! Would recommend her to anyone dealing with stomach issues!
